title: 110_hr1407
content:
The Act titled "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the phaseout beginning point for the deduction under section 221 based on modified adjusted gross income. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the phaseout beginning point for the deduction under section 221 based on modified adjusted gross income. The adjusted gross income is determined without regard to specific sections and after the application of certain adjustments. The $100,000 and $200,000 amounts in subsection (b) will be increased for taxable years beginning after 2008 based on the cost-of-living adjustment. These amendments will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2007. SEC. 3. Deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses made permanent. Repeal of termination in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Effective date for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007.

SEC. 4. Education savings accounts. Increase in allowable contributions to $5,000. Reports to be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. SEC. 5. Allowance of room, board, and special needs services for scholarships and tuition reduction programs in higher education. SEC. 5 amends the Internal Revenue Code to include qualified higher education expenses for enrollment at eligible educational institutions. It also defines these terms according to section 529(e) and modifies rules for tuition reduction programs. The amendments made by this section allow for the substitution of 'qualified higher education expenses' for 'tuition' in certain instances. These changes apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2007, for education provided in academic periods starting after that date. Expansion of educational expenses allowed as part of Hope Scholarship Credit. Expansion of qualified tuition and related expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at eligible educational institutions. The Hope Scholarship Credit will not be reduced by Federal Pell Grants and Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants. The amendments made by this section expand qualified tuition and related expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at eligible educational institutions. These amendments also specify that the Hope Scholarship Credit will not be reduced by Federal Pell Grants and Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants. The effective date for these changes is expenses paid after December 31, 2007, for education provided in academic periods starting after that date. SEC. 7. REPEAL OF EGTRRA SUNSET APPLICABILITY TO CERTAIN EDUCATION PROVISIONS. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 will not apply to subtitles A, B, and D of title IV of such Act.
